If you are blatantly saying things and then immediately backing away from the things you had just said then the correct answer is that you really are insane. I suppose you think it's great when governments operate with deficits.
Wait. What is with your mentality corporations = bad / governments = good? Are you insane?
You think Chinese / white American couples don't exist or that they don't spawn children?

Danny Rand goes to Kun Lun and get the power of Iron Fist.
Bruce Wayne goes to Tibet and becomes Batman.
Oliver Queen spends a couple of years on Lian Yu and becomes the Green Arrow.
Doctor Stephen Strange goes to Nepal and becomes Sorceror Supreme.
It isn't really about race. It's more like the idea that the mysterious East is a source of power.

K'un L'un isn't actually in China. It's in another dimension. That's like saying I would feel at home in Asgard or Olympus because I'm a white person.

WRITING.TITLE: Iron Fist: The Good, Bad Ugly

WRITING.TEXT:
would people be equating it to a university student from Beijing learning how to fence while attending boarding school in London?
Or an Asian American kid going to Harvard and playing on the University basketball team...
To be honest, there is an element of wish fulfillment. A lot of comics origin stories are designed so that the reader can imagine himself being the hero.

I've met biracial Chinese / white American kids who had blonde hair and blue eyes. It would have been very easy to say that Danny Rand's mother was Chinese and it would have played well if they had just gotten a Chinese actress to play his mother. It would have gone a long way towards explaining why she had business interests in China.

I've met biracial Chinese / white American kids who had blonde hair and blue eyes. It would have been very easy to say that Danny Rand's mother was Chinese and it would have played well if they had just gotten a Chinese actress to play his mother. It would have gone a long way towards explaining why she had business interests in China.
I don't think Marvel wants to do a Shang Chi series because he is such an Asian immigrant stereotype. Let's just wait and see how big a role Benedict Wong / Wong has in Avengers: Infinity War.
Governments call it "surplus". It is the opposite of deficit.
It started out okay, got worse, picked up again and got bad again but in the end it was on par with Luke Cage. I found Jessica Jones hard to watch.
Man was created in God's image and she had nipples. :)
I think Danny referred to "your father, Lei Kung". He was the one who meditated in the nude. I'd have to watch again to confirm but Lei Kung was mentioned.
So in the end the government has to collect money to pay workers like anybody else.
Because people need to get paid.
You're forgetting about research and development. It takes years.
Exactly and then we won't have the life saving drugs in the first place and more people will die.

Not quite sure where you inferred I want to stop the development of medical treatment.
You specifically said you didn't want corporations making money from the development of medicine.
The actor who plays Davos wasn't Chinese either.
You work with the actor that was cast. I've seen kids who were biracial Chinese / white American that had blonde hair and blue eyes.
Not really. It is about acceptance. It is about wanting to return to the world he knew.

No, you are fine with people dying. If nobody develops medicine then people die from preventable diseases. That's the real world. I don't want to live in your fantasy world. We'd be using leeches to drain people's blood to cure what ails them in your fantasy world.
Yes. People felt the same way about Man of Steel.

Fine. You're out of your frigging mind. We only have modern medicine because pharmaceutical companies exist.
Like I said, I now know what kind of mentality I am dealing with here.
Jessica Jones had a truly anti-climactic ending.

It just tells me where you are coming from. Corporations are entitled to make profits. They have employees to pay, after all.
You also probably thought Danny was right to close the plant even though nobody had established a causal link between the plant and the cancers.

WRITING.TITLE: Problems with Iron Fist
WRITING.TEXT:
First, let me say that after watching all 13 episodes I think it was better than Jessica Jones but not as good as Daredevil. It was on par with Luke Cage. It was okay.
But it could have been better. The biggest problem for me was the lack of positive male characters (other than Danny): Harold Meacham was evil, Ward Meacham was a little shit, Davos was an asshole, Bakuto was evil and Kyle was a wimp.
[I will, as far as I know, be the first to wonder out loud if Harold and Kyle were supposed to be a gay couple. Kyle was there after midnight. He presumably didn't go home. And the scene with the ice cream was just weird.]
Another problem was race. Yes, race. They could have easily made Danny biracial. They wouldn't have even had to cast a different actor: they could have just hired a Chinese actress to play his mother. Finn could have pulled it off: he was playing someone who had a foot in two different cultures as it was.
It actually would have made a lot more sense if Heather Rand had been Chinese. I mean, she was the one who introduced Madame Gao to Rand Corporation. How did that happen? I don't think we got the whole story. Did she know that Madane Gao was exporting drugs? If Heather Rand had been Chinese it would have been a bit more plausible.
Another problem was Danny's Mandarin. It actually sounded pretty good, but I have to wonder why he didn't use more of it, say with Madame Gao or Davos or with people in China. I realize that people don't want to read subtitles but a fair compromise would have had him going back and forth between English and Mandarin. If Danny and Davos were fluent in both then that's exactly how you would expect them to communicate.
Now who's being dumb? Selling medicine at cost when millions had been spent on research and development is a huge net loss.
I never said he wasn't dumb. He was selling medicine at cost after his company had spent millions on research and development. Duh.

Arrow is apparently what they were going for.
EDIT: This actually is the third year of Marvel Netflix, so presumably this would be where things go wrong.
I'm tired of people jaywalking and thinking they deserve to live! Call me Car Man! Spirit of Vengence!

You get assholes who say "Ni hao" to Asian people in America and its the only Chinese they know and you get assholes who say "Hello" to white people in Taiwan and then run away because its the only English they know.

Better yet, Barry went down a slippery slope when he had Eobard kill his mom. So if Iris is dead in the future doesn't Barry have to go back in time and make sure Iris dies? The problem with that theory is that Iris wasn't dead pre-Flashpoint. From original Barry's point of view, Iris isn't meant to die. So this would be an alternative future version of Barry that has already come to accept Iris' death. This strongly suggests that Barry is preventing the future that Savitar has already come to accept. From Savitar's point of view, this makes Barry the villain. Savitar literally ceases to exist when Barry saves Iris.

I still compare it to my situation here. When I first arrived in Taiwan, my Chinese wasn't that good and I would ask people if they could speak English. Now I don't bother. And, yes, I have spoken to Vietnamese, Japanese and Filipino people, respectively, in Chinese. Did I assume they could speak Chinese? Yes. Was I being racist? No, because even if I had known that these people weren't Chinese (which I didn't) you would think they they, living in Taiwan, would be able to speak the local language. Now, Danny sees Colleen and he first speaks to her in English so he's making the same assumption, namely that she speaks the local language. It is only later that he tries speaking Chinese with her.
That's really not so bad. Some foreigners who have lived in Taiwan a long time get really upset when people speak to them in English but, really, why would they think we can speak Chinese? A lot of foreigners arrive fresh off the plane and don't speak a word of Chinese. I actually appreciate people taking the effort to speak to me in English. It's not as if it is easy for them to learn. And if my Chinese is better than their English then I'll let them know. It's no big deal. Some people are just way too hung up on race and think that everybody is insulting them when they are actually being friendly.
Seriously, you may think "What the fuck? Why is he speaking to her in Mandarin?" when I was thinking the opposite: why was he speaking to Madame Gao and Davos in English when people in K'un L'un clearly could speak Mandarin? (I am assuming that Danny learned Mandarin in K'un L'un.)

Look at it this way: Danny wanted revenge against Harold for killing his parents but he offered Joy no evidence that Harold was responsible. And now she wants renge for her father's death.
I think if Harold Meacham hadn't already been legally dead then Ward and Danny would have gone to trial. There were no witnesses to say they didn't flat out murder Harold Meacham.
You, Sir, have won a no-prize.

Well, there was a rumor that they were auditioning Asian American actors. It was probably for the role of Davos. They finally went with Sacha Dhawan. Personally, I would have wanted someone more convincingly Tibetan but I can understand why they went with him. The guy was truly menacing. It's too bad we never heard him speak Mandarin. You would have thought that would have been how they communicated.

People can talk shit about Daredevil Season 2 but I don't think I am doing that. There were rumors when Daredevil Season 2 came out that they might not do Iron Fist. I actually liked Daredevil Season 2 better than Iron Fist but I think Iron Fist had its moments. I think the Netflix series as a whole have better villains than the movies because there is more time spent with them. The movies treat villains like the moles in wack-a-mole: they pop up and are knocked down by the time the movie is over. The villains on the Netflix series have been more menacing. Well, except maybe the Russians and the Irish in Daredevil Seasons 1 and 2, respectively: they only existed to have their heads smashed in.

WRITING.TITLE: What if we hadn't had Daredevil Season 2?
WRITING.TEXT:
They were originally going to have four series plus the Defenders. What would it have looked like?
When Daredevil Season 2 was announced suddenly Iron Fist was thrown into doubt. I think they were originally going to introduce Elektra as an antagonist in Iron Fist. She was going to be a member of the Hand. We would learn of her connection to Daredevil in the Defenders. I think the problems with Iron Fist stem from them not quite having enough story for thirteen episodes. I think the series turned out okay. It wasn't terrible.

It isn't so much the assumption that I can speak English as the assumption that I can't speak Mandarin. On the other hand, I have had people come up to me and speak to me in Mandarin and be surprised I can understand. I suppose if Mandarin is the only language they can speak then they are going to speak Mandarin. In this case, Danny could speak English and Mandarin and he was letting her know that Mandarin was an option.

WRITING.TITLE: The Marvel Easter Eggs In 'Iron Fist'

WRITING.TEXT: In Episode 6, why didn't they just kill Danny Rand? Why let him walk away?
I feel that the show had her shifting allegiance from the triads to the faction of the Hand that had been run by Nobu. She definitely had (no pun intended) a hand in his organisation.

The Hand-as-cult thing actually makes sense. Then you have members getting killed and coming back to life more violent than before. You can see how things could go from bad to worse.
Bakuto is definitely coming back. He said giving Harold eternal life was a mistake but there's no way he hadn't provided that for himself.
Sacha Dhawan was born in Bramhall, Stockport, Manchester, England, UK to Hindu parents. Should he have had an American accent?

Danny and her brother had lied to her about Harold being alive.
For all she knew, her troubles began when Danny showed up. Danny may not have been dealing drugs but maybe she thought Danny should have left well enough alone and not gotten all their lives in danger. She didn't realize Harold had been manipulating them.
Ward and Danny are running the company after killing her dad. How does that even happen?
She didn't believe her father was capable of murder.

1. Danny and her brother had lied to her about Harold being alive.
2. For all she knew, her troubles began when Danny showed up. Danny may not have been dealing drugs but maybe she thought Danny should have left well enough alone and not gotten all their lives in danger. She didn't realize Harold had been manipulating them.
3. Ward and Danny are running the company after killing her dad. How does that even happen?
4. She didn't believe her father was capable of murder.

Except that her drugs were always stamped with the symbol of the Steel Serpent.
And a charity organisation calling itself the Hand actually makes sense.
I'm a white guy living in Taiwan. Is it racist when people speak to me in English?

WRITING.TITLE: Extending the Avengers / Defenders analogy
WRITING.TEXT:
So people have pointed out the way Iron Fist has been promoted as the LAST Defender and how this is analogous to Captain America being the FIRST Avenger. There's also, the order in which the movies / shows came out to consider:
Iron Man - Daredevil
Hulk - Jessica Jones
Iron Man 2 - Daredevil 2
Thor - Luke Cage
Captain America - Iron Fist
Basically, Daredevil is like Iron Man as he is the most well known of the Defenders characters, not only to the general public but to comics readers as well because there was actually a long period of time after the cancellation of Power Man / Iron Fist was missing and presumed dead. Daredevil is also like Iron Man because he wears a full face mask. Well, actually, his mask is actually more like Captain America's because it does show his chin but Captain America rarely wore a mask in his movies and his identity was publicly known anyway.
To say Jessica Jones is like the Hulk is a bit of a stretch but she is, probably, the strongest of the main four Defenders. She also has anger issues as a result of PTSD. Oh, sure, Tony Stark suffered from PTSD in Iron Man 3 but it's not as if he had been repeatedly raped for weeks.
Again, to say that Luke Cage is like Thor is a stretch but Thor is immortal. Presumably a Judas bullet would hurt Thor in the same way that it would hurt Luke Cage. As Loki says "Humans think us immortal. Shall we test that?"
Iron Fist, meanwhile, while not actually frozen for years did come back to civilization years later after being considered dead after his plane crashed in the snow and ice. Like Steve Rogers, Danny Rand would have a lot of catching up to do: he wouldn't know who Rihanna or Lady Gaga were and he would have missed most of the X-Men movies. He should make a list of things to catch up on.
Eleltra was introduced in Daredevil Season 2 so that makes her similar to the Black Widow who was introduced in Iron Man 2. She also has "red in her ledger" because she was an assassin working for the chaste before she even met Matt Murdock. Elektra is also going to be similar to Hawkeye because presumably she will be an antagonist for the first few episodes of the series and will "feel better" once she "put[s] a sai in Alexandra's eye".
Colleen Wing is also like the Black Widow and Hawkeye. First, she's female and a martial artist so automatically she is more like the Black Widow than Hawkeye but the Black Widow only uses guns and he "widow's bite" as weapons so both Colleen Wing and Elektra are like Hawkeye because they all stab people with pointy weapons.
Trish and Misty are like Agents Phil Coulson and Maria Hill. Why? Well, because frankly they've been more like sidekicks than protagonists so far and, besides, if Misty loses her arm and gets it replaced with a bionic one then to people who don't read the comics she will seem a lot like Coulson.
Finally, Claire Temple is like Nick Fury, first of all because Claire Temple is played by Rosario Dawson and Nick Fury is played by Samuel L Jackson and they are both big name stars that Marvel able to score. Also, Claire Temple has been in every single one of the Marvel Netflix series and Nick Fury was in most of the Phase One Marvel movies (including mid and end credits scenes).
I like Sword-Woman and Sai-Woman.
At times, it kinda does.

I'm watching episode 4 and I am finding it really tedious. I thought the first three episodes were okay but there just aren't any pay offs. Ward Meacham is trying to kill Danny Rand but after Joy drugs him he just goes to a mental hospital. Danny wants to be released from a mental hospital but ultimately all he has to do is knock down the door. Danny tries to get his company back and then all he has to do is ask Harold Meacham. Time after time plot threads are ended unclimactically and, as a result, people get the feeling that the plot hasn't progressed after three episodes.
EDIT: Episode 7 is much better than Episode 6. Again, you have to ask why Gao doesn't simply have Danny killed.

Was Zoom after him for using his speed or was Zoom after him because he was time travelling?
Actually, it begs the question why the time wraiths were not after Eobard in Season 1. We found out about the time wraiths when Barry went back in time in Season 2 when Barry went back in time. We don't know how Eobard managed to hide from the time wraiths for 15 years but presumamably it is because he didn't have his speed for most of that time.

But we also know that Zoom would not be able to find him if he didn't use his speed.
"Now what they should have done was end this season of Legends with him stranded back when he killed Barry's mother, with his memory gone and his speed gone."
That's what we thought they were going to do but that's not what they ended up doing apparently.

"I think you're ignoring the fact that Legion Wells said that he was in Flashpoint, then released by Flash, and then immediately began being hunted by Zoom"
No, he didn't say that. He was much more vague about it. We assumed that he has been on the run immediately after Flashpoint but obviously we were wrong.
In present day, Caitlin and Cisco still remember Wellsobard. They wouldn't remember him if Eobard hadn't become Wellsobard.
"why did Eobard lose his speed when he stranded the first time, but not the second time?"
Exactly, he would have lost his speed again and would have had to become Wellsobard again.
It had to be completely different and we are getting an indication of that.
Yes so it makes sense. Wellsobard wanted to be able to time travel and apparently he can. He won.
We assumed that this Thawne had not beome Wellsobard... yet... but he had to become Wellsobard and apparently already has.
Yeah so things worked out differently this time... but obviously Eddie still killed himself.

First of all, the Avengers are in space at the end of Infinity War. Avengers 4 starts with the Defenders on Earth fighting a threat on Earth. The Avengers and the Guardians arrive to defeat the threat. The movie ends with a new status quo. I don't know the details. A lot depends on the ending of the previous movie and what actors are available when they film the opening scene of Avengers 4.
Take your own advice.
Korean coworker you've been into or Korean coworker you plan to be into soon?
I get excited when they say that the preview of the next episode includes spoiler.

You forget that after Barry reversed Flashpoint he returned to the present day and Eddie was still dead. Why was Eddie dead if Eobard hadn't become Wells? In fact, Barry shouldn't even be Flash yet because he originally became Flash years later. Except that was when his mother was still alive. Eobard lost his speed and had to make sure that Barry became the Flash to get it back.
By killing Nora, he loses his speed like the first time.

Well, yeah, if Reverse Flash kills Barry's mom then he is back to square one. Basically, he had to kill Barry's mom because this version of Barry Allen was never going to become the Flash and that meant that he would lose his own speed when Barry lost his. But when he kills Barry's mom then he will lose his own speed anyway and have to become Wellsobard all over again. Except this time he knows his plan ultimately didn't work. Or did it? Presumably Eddie kills himself again but instead of disappearing Wellsobard runs away and stays ahead of the Black Flash who would have destroyed him.

I would interpret "the nine realms" to be poetic like "the seven seas". I wouldn't interpret it to mean that the nine realms are all there is but rather that the rainbow bridge could be used to reach eight other realms in addition to Asgard.
In the comics, there is a tenth realm. http://marvel.wikia.com/wiki/Heven_(Tenth_Realm)
I did a reverse image search and the image is at least 8 years old. Someone apparently posted it on a Smallville forum saying it was her.
I don't think Arrow, by itself, is more popular than Smallville. In fact, without the crossover potential with Flash, Arrow could have been cancelled after Season 4.

The strongest evidence for SHIELD returning is the fact that the Inhumans series is only eight episodes. That leaves room in the schedule for Agents of SHIELD Season 5 to have about 14 episodes.
Then we'll see. A lot depends on ratings. There are many different scenarios.
1) Inhumans is a disappointment. People don't stick around for Agents of SHIELD Season 5. Both series are cancelled.
2) Inhumans is a disappointment but word of mouth causes people to watch Agents of SHIELD Season 5 and it gets renewed for Season 6.
3) Inhumans is a big success and it justifies the expense of filming in Hawaii. It is renewed for another season and Agents of SHIELD is cancelled.
4) Inhumans is a success but it is expensive to produce. It gets renewed for another eight episodes. This is good news for the cast of Agents of SHIELD because ABC will want a show to fill that time slot when they aren't showing Inhumans.
5) Marvel is being coy about renewing Agents of SHIELD because they are developing a movie in Phase 4 that will introduce the characters from Agents of SHIELD to people who don't watch the TV show, say for example a movie in which the Black Widow steps up to become Director of SHIELD. This would make a full season renewal unlikely because the actors would need to take a few months to film with Scarlet Johansson.
